data.title: Dancing Dolls
data.text: What a wonderful and exciting experience. The seats were comfortable and spacious. The audio system there was amazing. I really enjoyed myself.

data.title: Former theater converted for live performances.
data.text: Worth a trip to see the inside and find a seat that fits your preferences.  Leg room is tight and some seats don't offer the best view of the stage.

data.title: Seat ordering is deceiving
data.text: I went to the venue to see a Motown review but was disappointed to discover that the seat I thought I had purchased left me further away from the stage than it appeared...AND  left me trapped in a seat I thought had free egress and access to.

data.title: Wow
data.text: Great shows and amazing sound! If visiting from out of town see what is playing-ballet, symphony, concerts, and much more!

data.title: WOW!!!!!!
data.text: This place is big, clean, and very nice.......The Dancing Dolls did the dag on thang last night (7/17/16). I think I had more fun than my two girls.  I paid $10 for a pepsi and a bag of popcorn (that was too much....but hay it was an event)

data.title: Great venue
data.text: Lots of great shows at an historic venue in Richmond. Beautifully restored, good view of the stage from most seats in the house. They now have parking available at the Commonwealth parking garage on event nights. Definitely take advantage.

data.title: I love it!
data.text: This is a great place to see a show! I've been here three times the place is always clean and the staff is always friendly. They have adult beverages as well as snacks and drinks for people that do not drink alcohol. The architecture is amazing! The place is always clean.

data.title: Went to a marvelous show several weeks ago.
data.text: I've been to CenterStage several times over the last few years. The times I have been it has always been for a private show for a private dance company of some sort. Once was for a ballet school recital and once was for a CenterStage cooperative show put on with dancers from multiple private and public elementary schools. The building itself is a mixture of classic "Old School" theatre house and with several modern "Dance Space" additions. The staff (mostly volunteer) is always gracious and inviting. The theater is run efficiently and although there is always a lot going on, you never get the feeling of being in a "confused" place. My hat is off to the staff and crew of Richmond CenterStage.

data.title: Beautiful building and excellent orchestra
data.text: I attend about 6 performances per year. I enjoy the building architecture and its historical value very much. The Richmond CenterStage is located in the downtown area. Get there early enough to get parking on the street nearby. Parking across the street from the CenterStage is $10.

data.title: Christian Pop\Rock event
data.text: 2nd time at this venue in the past year (American Idol as well)  Facility, staff & parking were all excellent!  Richmond City provided plenty of security.  Great venue!

data.title: Lovely theater
data.text: I go to the Virginia Opera performances there and find the experience quite enjoyable. The acoustics are good and the libretto is easy to read from where we sit . A nice venue. Take a jacket or sweater, though, because sometimes they get the air conditioning too cold.

data.title: A wonderful place
data.text: Went for a TEDxRVA event this time. 9am-5pm a long time but still very enjoyable.  We have been here for plays, for the opera, for the symphony, etc.  A great old theatre.

data.title: A Grand Old Theater
data.text: I hear it was originally a Lowe's theater long ago. It is elegant, a mix of classic and nostangic. It has been kept up well. Seats are comfortable. Shows are mainly special events. Lots of parking nearby, for about $10. Many restaurants in the area, but book a table in advance because they fill quickly on event evenings.

data.title: Like Going Back in Time
data.text: Richmond CenterStage is a beautiful place to see a show or the symphony.  The acoustics are good and the decor is fabulous.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: CenterStage is a refurbished movie theatre (a Loews) from the 1930's.  Now it hosts a variety of shows, concerts, etc.  It is gorgeous inside; one could visit for the architecture alone.  Also, it is reported to be haunted, but I've never seen a ghost in the many visits I've made over the years.

data.title: Beautiful venue
data.text: I have been lucky enough to see a few performances here from the Richmond Symphony and Richmond Ballet - so much talent and a beautiful theater to experience it in. Highly recommend The Nutcracker!

data.title: Squeeze into 1st Dress Circle
data.text:
The Nutcracker was great, professional, funny, sad and overwhelmingly wonderful. But beware of row J, First Dress Circle.  The seats were squeezed up against row in front of us. I'm 5'7" and my knees dug into the seats in front of us. The seating in row J was not made for adults, period. The seats in front of us had plenty of room.
My recommendation, go to the ballet but don't sit in 1st Dress Circle row J.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: My wife and I took four of our grandchildren to see a presentation of the Nutcracker.  We are both tall, I had a total knee replacement and my wife is scheduled for one next week.   We bought tickets months ago and very specifically told the ticketing agent we wanted tickets on the aisle for each of us with three tickets on one row and three tickets on another row.  She showed us a seating diagram and the seats she said we were getting which met our request.  When we arrived today we had two sets of seats in the middle of a row with no opportunity to put our legs in an aisle to relieve the pressure on our knees.   We anticipated an enjoyable afternoon and it turned into a nightmare for each of us.  The Nutcracker was OK but the seating was horrible and one can't enjoy something when you are in pain.     There is no excuse for this given we made a special effort months ago to obtain acceptable tickets.

data.title: Wonderful venue, terrific acoustics
data.text: Every year I attend the Messiah at Richmond CenterStage, sitting  dress circle, first row center. The space post-renovation is beautiful, with the colors, lights, and statuary looking splendid. I even think the seats are more comfortable but, most importantly, the women's bathroom on the second level is renovated, large, and totally manageable. Wonder venue.

data.title: Excellent experience.
data.text: My family and I visited the Carpenter Theatre to see Peppa Pig. They opened the doors on time and the lobby area was spacious and clean. The actual theatre was very nice. It had charm to it because it looked old. However, the seats were comfortable, and the sound and lighting were great. My only complaint, which is not the theatre's fault, is the parking. Do not go to the parking garage because your car will barely fit in there. Park in the parking lot right across the street.
